segments.text: There’s a certain beauty in this chaotic moment, a snapshot of childhood innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet that joy feels tainted by the very real possibility of someone getting hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a pang of nostalgia for my own childhood misadventures.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I’m also reminded of the responsibilities that come with adulthood, like keeping things in order.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: As the children reach for those cookies, I feel a surge of adrenaline; it’s like watching a tightrope act.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: With every moment they linger in this risky play, the stakes seem to rise.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All I want is for them to be safe, to continue their joys without the shadow of calamity looming over them.
segments.speaker: PAR
